cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 560 miles SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest across the southeast Gulf, then turning northwest and north-northwest toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coasts
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX/LA border (roughly Sabine Pass – Cameron area)

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from Freeport TX to San Luis Pass TX and from the Mouth of the Mississippi River to Ocean Springs MS (not including Texas City)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from San Luis Pass TX to Intracoastal City LA; Storm Surge Warning from San Luis Pass TX to the Mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast including Galveston Bay, Freeport, Port Arthur, and the southwest Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: High likelihood (81%) of tropical-storm-force winds and a 52% chance of 50-kt winds; hurricane-force gusts possible if the core tracks slightly west of forecast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Galveston Bay and surrounding coastline could experience 3–5 ft of storm surge, with higher values (6–9 ft) just east toward Port Bolivar–Sea Rim State Park.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches of rain with isolated pockets up to 12 inches, leading to flash and urban flooding potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; possible brief tornadoes in outer rainbands.
